name: Peyvên Pirsê û Malbat
description: Learn the 8 Kurdish question words, cardinal directions, family vocabulary with maternal/paternal distinctions, and singular-to-plural possessives.

lessons.name: Peyvên Pirsê
lessons.description: Learn the 8 Kurdish question words: çi, çawa, çend, çima, kî, kê, li ku, ji ku — and cardinal directions.

learningObjective.en: Learn the 8 Kurdish question words: çi, çawa, çend, çima, kî, kê, li ku, ji ku — and cardinal directions
learningObjective.de: Lerne die 8 kurdischen Fragewörter: çi, çawa, çend, çima, kî, kê, li ku, ji ku — und die Himmelsrichtungen

content.example: Ev çi ye? — Ev av e.

exampleTranslation.en: What is this? — This is water.
exampleTranslation.de: Was ist das? — Das ist Wasser.

content.example: Tu çawa yî? — Ez baş im.

exampleTranslation.en: How are you? — I am good.
exampleTranslation.de: Wie geht es dir? — Mir geht es gut.

exampleTranslation.en: Why are you crying? — I am sick, therefore I am crying.
exampleTranslation.de: Warum weinst du? — Ich bin krank, deshalb weine ich.

instruction.en: Learn the difference: kî vs. kê
instruction.de: Lerne den Unterschied: kî vs. kê

content.example: Tu kî yî? — Tu kê dibînî?

exampleTranslation.en: Who are you? — Whom do you see?
exampleTranslation.de: Wer bist du? — Wen siehst du?

lines.ku: Ev çi ye? — Ev jîrfon e.
lines.en: What is this? — This is a smartphone.
lines.de: Was ist das? — Das ist ein Smartphone.

lines.ku: Tu çawa yî? — Ez baş im.
lines.en: How are you? — I am good.
lines.de: Wie geht es dir? — Mir geht es gut.

lines.ku: Tu çend salî yî? — Ez bîst û yek salî me.
lines.en: How old are you? — I am 21 years old.
lines.de: Wie alt bist du? — Ich bin 21 Jahre alt.

lines.ku: Tu çima digirî? — Ez nexweş im, loma digirîm.
lines.en: Why are you crying? — I am sick, therefore I cry.
lines.de: Warum weinst du? — Ich bin krank, deshalb weine ich.

lines.ku: Tu kî yî? — Ez Hêlîn im.
lines.en: Who are you? — I am Hêlîn.
lines.de: Wer bist du? — Ich bin Hêlîn.

lines.ku: Tu kê dibînî? — Ez keçê dibînim.
lines.en: Whom do you see? — I see the girl.
lines.de: Wen siehst du? — Ich sehe das Mädchen.

lines.ku: Li ku bi almanî çi ye? — Li ku bi almanî wo ye.
lines.en: What is 'li ku' in German? — 'Li ku' in German is 'wo' (where).
lines.de: Was heißt 'li ku' auf Deutsch? — 'Li ku' ist auf Deutsch 'wo'.

lines.ku: Ji ku bi almanî çi ye? — Ji ku bi almanî woher ye.
lines.en: What is 'ji ku' in German? — 'Ji ku' in German is 'woher' (where from).
lines.de: Was heißt 'ji ku' auf Deutsch? — 'Ji ku' ist auf Deutsch 'woher'.

instruction.en: "Tu kê dibînî?" — What does 'kê' mean here?

explanation.en: kê = whom (accusative/object). It asks about the person being seen. Compare: kî = who (subject), kê = whom (object). "Tu kê dibînî?" = Whom do you see?
explanation.de: kê = wen (Akkusativ/Objekt). Es fragt nach der Person, die gesehen wird. Vergleich: kî = wer (Subjekt), kê = wen (Objekt). "Tu kê dibînî?" = Wen siehst du?

instruction.en: "Tu ji ku derê Kurdistanê yî?" — "Ez ji bakurê Kurdistanê me." What is bakur?
instruction.de: "Tu ji ku derê Kurdistanê yî?" — "Ez ji bakurê Kurdistanê me." Was ist bakur?

explanation.en: bakur = north. The four directions: bakur (north), başûr (south), rojava (west), rojhilat (east). "Ez ji bakurê Kurdistanê me" = I am from northern Kurdistan.
explanation.de: bakur = Norden. Die vier Himmelsrichtungen: bakur (Norden), başûr (Süden), rojava (Westen), rojhilat (Osten). "Ez ji bakurê Kurdistanê me" = Ich komme aus Nordkurdistan.

explanation.en: çend = how many. "Tu çend salî yî?" = How old are you? (Literally: You how-many years-old are?)
explanation.de: çend = wie viele. "Tu çend salî yî?" = Wie alt bist du? (Wörtlich: Du wie-viele Jahre-alt bist?)

explanation.en: ji ku = where from. "Tu ji ku yî?" = Where are you from?
explanation.de: ji ku = woher. "Tu ji ku yî?" = Woher kommst du?

lessons.name: Malbat û Diyalog
lessons.description: Learn 10+ family terms with maternal/paternal distinctions, singular-to-plural possessives, and the verb hatin (to come).

learningObjective.en: Learn 10+ family terms, singular-to-plural possessives, and the verb hatin (to come)
learningObjective.de: Lerne 10+ Familienbegriffe, Singular-zu-Plural-Possessivformen und das Verb hatin (kommen)

translation.en: ez têm, tu tê, ew tê, em/hûn/ew tên
translation.de: ich komme, du kommst, er/sie kommt, wir/ihr/sie kommen

exampleTranslation.en: My cousin comes from the university.
exampleTranslation.de: Mein Cousin kommt von der Universität.

lines.speaker: A
lines.ku: Xatiya te çend salî ye?
lines.en: How old is your aunt (maternal)?
lines.de: Wie alt ist deine Tante (mütterlicherseits)?

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Xatiya min çil salî ye.
lines.en: My aunt is 40 years old.
lines.de: Meine Tante ist 40 Jahre alt.

lines.speaker: A
lines.ku: Ew çi karî dike?
lines.en: What is her job?
lines.de: Was ist ihr Beruf?

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Ew mamoste ye.
lines.en: She is a teacher.
lines.de: Sie ist Lehrerin.

lines.speaker: A
lines.ku: Ew kê dibîne?
lines.en: Whom does she see?
lines.de: Wen sieht sie?

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Xatiya min xalê xwe dibîne.
lines.en: My aunt sees her (own) uncle.
lines.de: Meine Tante sieht ihren (eigenen) Onkel.

lines.speaker: A
lines.ku: Navê kurxalê te çi ye?
lines.en: What is your cousin's (maternal, male) name?
lines.de: Wie heißt dein Cousin (mütterlicherseits)?

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Navê kurxalê min Alan e. Ew panzdeh salî ye.
lines.en: My cousin's name is Alan. He is 15 years old.
lines.de: Mein Cousin heißt Alan. Er ist 15 Jahre alt.

lines.speaker: A
lines.ku: Bapîrê te baş e?
lines.en: Is your grandfather well?
lines.de: Geht es deinem Großvater gut?

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Erê, bapîrê min baş e. Ew pir dikene.
lines.en: Yes, my grandfather is well. He laughs a lot.
lines.de: Ja, meinem Großvater geht es gut. Er lacht viel.

lines.speaker: A
lines.ku: Ew ji ku ye?
lines.en: Where is he from?
lines.de: Woher kommt er?

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Ew ji Îngilistanê ye.
lines.en: He is from England.
lines.de: Er kommt aus England.

lines.speaker: A
lines.ku: Pismamê te ji ku tê?
lines.en: Where does your cousin (paternal, male) come from?
lines.de: Woher kommt dein Cousin (väterlicherseits)?

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Pismamê min ji zanîngehê tê. Ew dibe endezyar.
lines.en: My cousin comes from the university. He will become an engineer.
lines.de: Mein Cousin kommt von der Universität. Er wird Ingenieur.

instruction.en: What is the difference between xal and ap?
instruction.de: Was ist der Unterschied zwischen xal und ap?

options.en: xal = uncle (mother's side), ap = uncle (father's side)

explanation.en: Kurdish distinguishes maternal and paternal relatives: xal = uncle (mother's brother), ap = uncle (father's brother). Similarly: xatî = aunt (mother's side), met = aunt (father's side).
explanation.de: Kurdisch unterscheidet mütterliche und väterliche Verwandte: xal = Onkel (Bruder der Mutter), ap = Onkel (Bruder des Vaters). Ebenso: xatî = Tante (mütterlicherseits), met = Tante (väterlicherseits).

instruction.en: "Bapîrê min baş e. Ew pir dikene." — What does bapîr do?
instruction.de: "Bapîrê min baş e. Ew pir dikene." — Was macht der Großvater?

explanation.en: dikene = laughs (from kenîn). pir = a lot. "Ew pir dikene" = He laughs a lot.
explanation.de: dikene = lacht (von kenîn). pir = viel. "Ew pir dikene" = Er lacht viel.

instruction.en: Study singular to plural possessive changes

lines.ku: Diya min çiya dibîne. → Diyên me çiya dibînin.
lines.en: My mother sees the mountain. → Our mothers see the mountain.
lines.de: Meine Mutter sieht den Berg. → Unsere Mütter sehen den Berg.

lines.ku: Xalê min pêjgîrê difroşe. → Xalên me pêjgîrê difroşin.
lines.en: My uncle sells pots. → Our uncles sell pots.
lines.de: Mein Onkel verkauft Töpfe. → Unsere Onkel verkaufen Töpfe.

lines.ku: Bapîrê te sîrê dixwe. → Bapîrên we sîrê dixwin.
lines.en: Your grandfather eats garlic. → Your grandfathers eat garlic.
lines.de: Dein Großvater isst Knoblauch. → Eure Großväter essen Knoblauch.

lines.ku: Birayê min solê dişo. → Birayên we solê dişon.
lines.en: My brother washes shoes. → Your brothers wash shoes.
lines.de: Mein Bruder wäscht Schuhe. → Eure Brüder waschen Schuhe.

lines.ku: Hevala wî şa ye. → Hevalên wî şa ne.
lines.en: His friend (f) is happy. → His friends are happy.
lines.de: Seine Freundin ist glücklich. → Seine Freunde sind glücklich.

instruction.en: Make it plural: Xalê min difroşe. → ___ me difroşin.
instruction.de: Bilde den Plural: Xalê min difroşe. → ___ me difroşin.

explanation.en: Singular: Xalê min (my uncle). Plural: Xalên me (our uncles). The -ê changes to -ên, and min changes to me.
explanation.de: Singular: Xalê min (mein Onkel). Plural: Xalên me (unsere Onkel). Das -ê wird zu -ên, und min wird zu me.

explanation.en: hatin (to come): ew tê (he/she comes). My cousin comes from the university. Note: hatin has irregular conjugation: ez têm, tu tê, ew tê, em/hûn/ew tên.
explanation.de: hatin (kommen): ew tê (er/sie kommt). Mein Cousin kommt von der Universität. Hinweis: hatin hat eine unregelmäßige Konjugation: ez têm, tu tê, ew tê, em/hûn/ew tên.
